title: Centralized caching with delegated ownership
summary: Cache external reference data once, while delegating cache population logic to the owning domain teams.

decisionGuidance.problemSolved: Modernization often increases external calls; without caching, cost and latency explode.
whenToUse: External data is reused across many flows
External systems have rate limits or high latency
whenNotToUse: Data must always be real-time and cannot be cached

gotchas: Stale cache causes incorrect business decisions
thingsToWatchOutFor.opinionatedGuidance: Cache is a product: define owners, TTL, invalidation, and fallback behavior.

complexity.rationale: Implementation is manageable; correctness is the challenge.
complexity.skillDemand: Distributed caching design and domain ownership discipline.
complexity.operationalDemand: Moderateâ€”monitor hit rate, staleness, and fallbacks.

starterDiagram.title: Shared lookup
starterDiagram.description: Domains use cache instead of calling external each time.

realWorldExample.approach: Central cache served common lookups and reduced repeated calls.
realWorldExample.outcome: Lower latency and more predictable cost.
